title: Cartesian Equation of a Line Quiz
description: Test your understanding of Cartesian equations of lines.

questions.question: What is the Cartesian form of a line equation?
questions.explanation: The Cartesian form is the symmetric form with direction ratios in the denominators.

questions.question: In the equation (x-1)/2 = (y-2)/3 = (z-3)/4, what do 2,3,4 represent?
questions.explanation: The numbers 2,3,4 are the direction ratios of the line.

questions.question: What happens if a direction ratio is zero?
options: The line becomes parallel to an axis
questions.explanation: Zero direction ratio means the coordinate doesn't change, making the line parallel to that axis.

questions.question: How do you convert vector form r = a + t b to Cartesian form?
options: Solve for t in each coordinate

questions.question: The Cartesian equation represents:
questions.explanation: The Cartesian equation represents all points on the infinite line.
